title: How does Karmaʻs passive work?
body:
Karmaʻs passive "Lower ultimate cooldown by 3 seconds everytime you hit an abilitiy, lower it by 1 second every auto"

I donʻt understand. I tested this earlier and it seems random. Is it just by every random ability? Or only empowered abilities by R? 

Karmaʻs R cooldown starts 45. I shoot a target with R+Q and I looked and its still 45. I auto one and its still 45. I do regular Q and its still 45. Then I donʻt pay attention during laning phase and somehow the cooldown is at 43 seconds and so on. Can someone explain?

replies.body: It reduces the remaining seconds for your ultimate not the actual ultimate cooldown. 43 seconds cooldown is probably because of the cdr per level rune.

It's all abilities, even those empowered by her R.

If she hits 3 champions with R >Q, it'll knock 9 seconds off the cooldown.

If she auto attacks someone, one sec off.

Right now it's Champions that reduce cooldown. In future it may be Large jung mobs/Epics too.

Every time you do any damage your R cooldown goes down, for every hit.

Landing an empowered RQ on multiple champs basically resets it. normal Q is just 3 seconds per hit, W is per damage tick, ect.
